I opted for the wine pairing, a lovely white wine that paired perfectly with the house special (but I can't remember what it was!!) The atmosphere was perfect for before a concert, lively with music playing! It was a bit challenging to hear my date on the other side of the table, but we were getting ready to party and it started to vibe just right.
author: Natalia V.

description:
Finally, a world class Peruvian place in San Francisco. We have a had a wave of these Peruvian places over the years and I'm sorry, but none of them compare to Mochica. If have every made Peruvian ceviche or yucca-based sides you know that timing is everything, combining ingredients for too long before plating or over cooking even the slightest bit can be a disaster. 

Mochica scores. and I will keep coming back here. no question. 

Make a reservation on weekends. maybe even on a weeknight, just in case. this place is popular for a reason. everything they do is top notch.

for the ceviches, start with the Chino. Reserve the Chicken (whole) in advance. Get a few of the skewers to share/fight over, and for dessert, give them a 15-min. heads up on the lava cake or just go for the churros dipped in their (justifiably "famous") hot chocolate with duche de leche stuffed inside. High marks for the seafood paella and anything with the pork belly (hard to mess that last one up though).

Fabulous table service. Loved our waitress and the gentleman assigned to our drinks and food running was exceptional. 

PS: also noticed a few people dining solo here (men and women), and there is a bar and a TV so perhaps not just a nice date spot, or a group dinner, but a place you might MEET your next partner for your next "date night" too.
author: Mike V.

description:
Seemed like a lovely place from the on set. A busy Friday night. Got seated relatively quick and the server seemed nice. They had a great and diverse menu, both food and cocktails. So why the two stars?? 

Ok, so unfortunately we are a bit of a pain in the ass due to a gluten intolerance (no pun intended!!), so asking what is gluten friendly is always an awkward convo with the server at the start of any meal. So he explained our options and ceviche, scallops, a salad, sautéed spinach and a stir fry got ordered with some drinks. 





This space represents the speed of our food and drinks arriving ( drinks were delicious), ceviche first with corn removed......, next the salad without strawberries, cheese, corn, orange and quinoa (as we requested it gluten free ), then eventually my starter arrived..... after my wife had finished her food. Delicious quinoa encrusted scallops. The food is what prevented a one star review. 

I ate my scallops. Waited. And waited. At one point we waited 15 minutes with empty drinks (having ordered more wine) and no food until eventually we had enough. We cancelled my beef stir fry and the similarly elusive sautéed spinach and asked for the check. The kitchen staff got blamed once again and we promptly left. 

We will definitely not be revisiting this restaurant which is unfortunate as the potential in both the food, drinks and location is huge. 

Ps, the hostess on the night did a walk around and avoided all the tables that were lacking in both food and drinks, stepped on a chip on the floor, looked at it and left it for someone else to clean up/ fall on. 

Hope the owners invest in a manager at some stage soon for their own good.
author: Rob L.

description:
After my initial visit, I've surmised that Mochica would be a bit spendy for a quick lunch, & is a touch casual for a proper dinner. In either case, you'll enjoy pretty presentations of Peruvian fare in a contemporary space. 

I thought it odd to see a reasonably-priced $20 Lomo Saltado (delicious, but heavily salted) on the menu alongside price offenders such as the tiny $4 glasses of passion fruit & chica morada (a corn drink, purple in color, which she described as tasting like corcord grape juice) and the exorbitant two for $8 alfajores dessert. 

Our share plates -- Mushroom Chicharrones & Tequenos (wontons stuffed with Oaxaca cheese & served with a sweet tamarind sauce or a savory avocado purée) -- $11 and $13, respectively, were filling & perfectly fried. 

In light of already having so many go-to restaurants in the Potrero Hill neighborhood, I was slow to give Mochica a chance, but I'll be quick to return!
author: Fancypants X.

description: Varied menu with full bar,  piscos, and cocktails to choose from. A lot of Peruvian favorites from ceviche to anticuchos, to risotto. The lively fun atmosphere and staff are a delight in addition to the food.
author: stoke k.

description:
It was alright. The menu is pretty limited and kinda screws you if you're not into rice. They have a few beers on tap, but it's not much of a selection by SF standards. It's also pretty pricey for a lunch.

Still the place is really nice inside and the staff are attentive.
author: Justin A.

description: The service was what left a bad taste in our mouths. The waiter was pushy about ordering drinks, add-ons, and even sparkling water when we didn't want any of those things. The waiters rushed us by taking our food away without really asking me (asked WHILE taking it away). The food was overpriced for sure. The $19 ceviche had two shrimps, two mussels and 5 pieces of fish, all of which were soaked in a super sour sauce. The spinach side order was $8 and was probably only 2 oz of spinach. The service was even worse towards the end as the waiter SLAMMED the check on the table. I'm never coming back, and you shouldn't go.
author: Celia L.

description:
Went here after church on afternoon. Solid Peruvian cuisine. I ordered the ceviche with a side of plantain chips and a mushroom and cheese empanada. With it being the season of Lent, I had to steer clear of meet and this place was perfect for that!

Full bar, but I coffee and water. Great friendly staff. Cute decor. Two rooms for dining. Pricing was average for the cuisine.

Ceviche was great! Had the mixto, so it was a little bit of everything. Pretty filling on its own. I couldn't even finish the empanada. I only ate a quarter of it, but it was super rich and filling. They definitely didn't skimp on the mushrooms or the cheese. The dough was amazing and you gotta love that powdered sugar that seems odd but tastes perfect!
author: Krystal T.

description: Delicious. Came with friends for my birthday dinner and we started with the pisco sour - a delicious drink. We shared ceviche, calamari, and a delicious chicken dish, beef dish, and seafood paella. The flavors were incredible. Better than Fresca. Great for sharing and family style. Nice ambiance also, fun but not to loud. Highly recommend.
author: Hollin C.

description:
Over priced okay food with bad service. Dishes and cocktails are just okay, but they're priced like you are eating at one of the restaurants that has earned 5 stars by Michelin standards. 
Even though my group and I had a reservation, the hostess told us that she'd get the table ready but never seated us. Then just when one of our party members got his good, we were asked by the hostess if we could rush and finish our dinner because it had been 3 hours when in fact it had only been two hours. Then we wanted to leave after taking a bite from the food, and they charged us for the food we didn't even get to finish. 
There are better Peruvian restaurants in the city with about the same priced dishes but with better quality food and drinks such as Limon. 
Like my friends, I won't be going back to this place.
author: Yasin B.

description: I had much higher expectations for this place. I have tried almost all Peruvian restaurants in San Francisco and Mochica is just okay. The location and decor are great but the service and food not so much. If you are going after traditional Peruvian food this is not the place, but its good for Saturday brunch. Service was not very fast, they forgot our chicha morodas, but they did make up for it at the end. Overall 3.3 out of 5.
author: Yéva M.

description:
Woohoo! As good as it gets!
Ceviche, OMG!
Carnitas, OMG!!!!
Bill, Worth It!
author: Cuauhtemoc C.

description: Very original dishes scallops Carlitos ! Pulpito a la Parilla   And. Ceviche ! miam friendly service
author: Gilberte G.

description: Great food!-a true Peruvian experience having just come back from the Sacred Valley. Will definitely come back !
author: Jim C.

description: I just happen to stumble upon this amazing restaurant. It is definitely my favorite in San Francisco. I've been back twice ordered different items and drinks from the menu everything tasted great and full of flavor. The wait staff is very nice and I also as their suggestions. I would highly recommend reservations though!
author: Dani K.

description:
Fm little neighborhood walk in restaurant.  They take reservations too.  Located in a cozy corner, we stopped by for a quick drink before dinner.  Loved the neighborhood vibe and the drinks were refreshing.

18th street is definitely worth a visit.  Comprised of mostly neighborhood customers it was nice to get out of the hub bub of tourist sites and get some local ambience.  We booked a reservation for Saturday night at the restaurant across the street.  Can't wait!
author: Susan C.

description:
Price : standard 
Atmosphere: love the bar area sunlights make it work
Drinks:
- (craveable) maracuya sour: sweet but flavorful
- Pisco sour: perfect

Food:
- lomo Saltado: good but a little salty
- yucca fries: have with the ceviche it is worth the wait
- (craveable) pescado ceviche: top notch
author: Cameron M.

description: Last time I visited Mochica the kitchen decided to close before 21.00 when normally closes at 22.00. Unfortunately no one informed us and when the rest of our friends arrived they actually couldn't eat.  They very polite explained to us that the kitchen can close earlier if the believe they done for the day.....
author: Christina P.

description: We came on a Tuesday night for dinner (made a reservation in advance). Super yummy ceviche - tried 2 different kinds, along with the grilled squid (AMAZING) and beet salad. I loved them all. Will definitely be coming back for dinner again. The service was attentive, ambiance great, and food superb. Good drink list as well.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I was headed to Chez Maman but they ended up being closed for the night. Mochica was really close and looked great too so I decided to try it for dinner. 

A friend and I ordered two of the ceviches, mac & cheese and the salmon to split (we were having a fat night, don't judge us!). 

The ceviches were both great! Fresh and well prepared. If that's all we had ordered I would have given Mochica a solid 4 stars and planned on returning. 

Unfortunately the mac n cheese was the worst I've ever had at a restaurant (or at home for that matter). It was SO salty that we could barely eat it. I came from the gym and was pretty hungry so I ate more of it than I should have. This wasn't a tad over seasoned - it was egregiously salty and I love salty food. My friend took two bites and didn't have any more. I can't imagine this is there recipe so maybe it was a mistake? New chef with a heavy hand or mismeasured?

The salmon was in a similar state. Really salty and unenjoyable. 

If I were the type of person to send food back it would have been warranted but I've never been able to do that. 

Giving it a 3 because the ceviche was good and I'm hoping that our salt overload was a mistake vs their normal preparation.
author: Amber F.

description: It had been nearly a year ago since I came to have dinner at this restaurant and had forgotten the reasons why I had not been back. This time I came to have brunch and to start it took some time for anyone to come to attend to our table as the staff seemed out of place, but once the server came she took our order for drinks and appetizers, she brought part of the drinks and completely forgot the rest of the drinks "coffees".  After placing our main course meal the appetizers still not coming out and quite a few minutes later the servers came back to let us know that they were out of their pollo a las brazas and so we had to change our order and no food still coming out. We had to ask twice before the brought us mediocre cold coffee and after 30+ minutes and double and triple checking with the server about our appetizers she commented that they were coming, as expected one of three appetizers came after we had been served our meals at which time we cancelled the rest of the appetizers and asked for more coffee and after several minutes they brought us more of that yummy cold coffee which was undrinkable and may have as well asked for a Starbucks Ice coffee.  It seems hard to believe that after a year since my last visit this restaurant has not worked out most of the basic service details.
author: Daniel B.

description:
The food was good! Some things to try
Appetizers: chicarrones were really tender
Entrees: Chafu pork belly!
Desserts: alfajores and churros
author: Sean H.

description: It was just okay. I've had waaaaaay better Peruvian cuisine. The plantains were hard and dry and when a Peruvian place doesn't make their own chicha drink....I'll never be back.
author: Jyk K.

description: Nice atmosphere - but not a go-to for me moving forward. I had the Lomo Saltado, typical dish, and was not overly impressed. I just feel that it lacked in flavor. Side note - the hostess was not the friendliest.
author: Melisa K.

description: This place is awesome. The ambiance, the service, the food all were incredible (highly recommend the pork belly fried rice). Will definitely be one of my go-to staples! YUMMM.
author: Leslie M.

description:
- delicious Peruvian food
- gluten-free options
- vegetarian offerings
- friendly and knowledgeable service
- mellow vibe
- beautiful, rustic, light-filled ambiance - lots of windows
- full bar {Mondays All Night | Tuesdays - Fridays 5p - 7p} http://www.mochicasf.com/happy-hour

We enjoyed a wonderful brunch {10a - 2.30p on weekends}. My Potrero Scramble had a nice balance of flavors - eggs, arugula, oyster mushrooms (sans goat cheese) with fried potatoes ($14). My husband had a big bowl of gluten-free chicken soup with a cilantro broth and a side of chicken sausage. Our server was knowledgeable, friendly, and made great recommendations. I look forward to coming back!
author: Cathy K.

description:
I wanted to 5 star this place. I really did. The salmon was flavorful. But they drenched my tuna in bbq sauce. And this is from a guy who loves bbq sauce. Im like who does that. Can I have some tuna with my bbq sauce. -1 star. 

The appetizer came after we were done with our meal. Im not picky about service but when you happen to notice you dish there waiting and your waiter chatting it up with his friends you cant help but be annoyed. -1 star.

My date got lightweight food poisoning. -1 star.  
(I know, should be like minus all the stars right? Well there a 70% chance it was from mochica. And the salmon tasted really good. not worth the food poisoning good. but good. lol) 

FYI: Its portrero hill SF. so dont even think about trying to find a place to park. Uber or Luxe if you dare.
author: Will L.

description: I had a wonderful experience with my girlfriend here. We started off with a Pisco Sour and Pisco Punch, which were both delicious. They were out of yucca fries, but their Bolitas de Yucca didn't disappoint. I'd recommend the Aji de Gallina followed by the Ceviche Chino, and can't wait to go back and explore more of the menu. Great date spot, but also perfect for small groups. Be sure to make a reservation in advance before you visit!
author: Josh B.

description: Wonderful food!! Service was good and very affordable. In my neighborhood makes it even better.
author: Jesse C.

description: We came here for some small eats before heading out to dinner, and really we could have just stayed here.  We sat at the bar and was served a small bowl of chips and salsa.  Ordered a few appetizers from the menu that were all good.  Mac and cheese hit the spot.  Had a couple of skewered meat as well that were good.  It's a nice date night place.  Casual with good food and service in a nice walkable neighborhood of SF.
author: Ronny T.

description: Wow!!! What a lovely, LOVELY restaurant!!!! Our oldest son, Scott, made reservations for our family to meet tonight. We enjoyed AMAZING food, wine, and each other!!!  I highly recommend Mochica!!!
author: Dianne M.

description: Went here for lunch. I ordered Ceviche mixto and all 3 of the empanadas. Ceviche had a nice spiciness to it along with fresh ingredients. All empanadas were tasty, came with a side of salsa and top with powdered sugar. Very delicious! One less star because this totaled to almost $60.
author: Christina W.

description:
As always, this place doesn't disappoint. The ceviche mixto was fresh with the perfect amount of spice. The classic Lomo Saltado was delicious. The authentic chicha morada has a sweet and tangy taste. The ambiance is hip with an authentic flare.

This is definitely a go to Peruvian restaurant if you're in the Bay.
author: Laura M.

description: This is over-the-top good Peruvian! Their happy hour is mouth watering. I can't imagine how good dinner must be. The crispy pork chops and the ceviche are not to be missed. Absolutely delucious!
author: Amy Jo G.

description: The service here is incredible- they treat you like family. The food is delicious. What more could you want? Love this place so much!
author: Frieda B.

description: Great service and a nice space. Props on the pisco sour, although it was on the sweet side. The chancho adobado was phenomenal, and the fish ceviche and beef empanadas were great too. The alfajores, suspiro and lucuma ice cream were tasty desserts as well.
author: Mike J.

description: What an amazing find this place. The food was so rich and spectacular unique very authentic  higher end  Peruvian cuisine. Pollo al ahi was an amazing stake in papa a la gUancaina.  In a delicious yellow curry-like sauce.   The octopus "pulpito"  appetizer-good quantity but too little seasoning   Very basic grilled taste. We also had a great lomo saltado.
author: David C.

description:
Food was super delicious and it's probably the only thing that saved us from having a terrible dining experience. The service was awful. If you know it's going to be a busy Saturday night, then staff well for it. Don't think the waiter even knew she had our table, bar couldn't produce drinks in a timely matter, no one refilled water, took plates before we were finished, gave us the wrong dishes that we didn't order, barely checked in on us (only when she realized we were getting frustrated), never asked to refill cocktails...we only got service because we had to aggressively ask for it. 

However- like I said, the food was amazing. The spare ribs app, octopus app, beef empanada, and mushroom empanda were awesome. I will be back for the food, and I hope the service will be better.
author: Denise H.

description: Amazing restaurant. The food is always fantastic and the service is always superb. It's a restaurant I like to take my out of town guests to or even just for date night. The specialty cocktails are tasty too.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Treated a friend for a Birthday Brunch yesterday and was blown away by the quality of the food, the service and the wonderful energy of the staff. 
In fact I just booked again to take my out of town guests to Mochica at the end of the month.
I can't wait to ordered the chicken..
author: Jane F.

description:
Good food definitely different should say big variety of seafood, seafood is Don with  Peruvian touch.
Good drinks and good customer service friendly environment.
author: Serge B.

description:
Food and service was great. This is a complaint about the hostess only which might be a restaurant policy, I don't know. Here's what I experienced.

So, I have been to this restaurant a couple of times all with great experiences, but this last time I got a little put-off by the hostess. On a Wednesday night we were brought into the room with only tables, not in the bar area, and at the time we sat around 6:00 there were only 3 tables in use out of 11 (including us). I wanted to sit next to my girlfriend and so we asked if we could sit at one of the 8 4-top tables that were open so we could sit next to each other. It isn't very often in San Francisco that you can sit next to your dining partner unless you are eating at the bar. The hostess asked if we were expecting more people in our party to which we replied no. She then informed us that they are holding those tables open for the reservations coming later that night. I pressed and she again told us that we couldn't sit at a 4-top with only 2 of us dining. 

As she left she muttered something in Spanish to the trainee who was with her. My girlfriend translated it to be "Never sit 2 people at a 4-top. Just tell them they are being held for reservations". I was pretty pissed off, nearly left, but when the waitress came and greeted us she immediately asked if we wanted anything and I said "yeah, I want to sit next to my girlfriend." She said it wouldn't be a problem for us to move to one of the open 4-tops, and by the time we left at 7:45 there were still 4 open 4-tops.

I think the hostesses/management should use a little more common sense when it comes to catering to the wishes of their patrons instead of following a policy because the policy exists.

After all was said and done I would still go back. Our waitress was excellent and the food was mighty tasty.
author: Nathan N.

description: I came to celebrate my birthday today and I enjoyed Lomo Saltado and it was delicious. We tried the Ceviche mixto, and it was pretty good, a little spicy for me as a Mexican, but you can ask mild spice. At the end I tried a delicious flan and churros with cajeta. I really recommend this restaurant , I'll come back for sure:-)
author: Patricia G.

description: Had brunch here on a Sunday morning after volunteering at the SF Food Bank.  Service was excellent.  Our server was very courteous and attentive.  The pork belly fried rice is highly recommended.  My daughter ordered their mac n cheese; and it was surprisingly really tasty and unique.  The lomo saltado chunks of beef were very tender and flavorful.  Seafood paella was good but didn't strike me as extra special compared to others I've had.  For dessert, you need to have their churros.  It took a while but worth the wait.  They came out freshly made, warm and oozing with dulce de leche; and comes with a small cup of hot chocolate.  Just the perfect way to cap the meal.
author: Lynn R.

description:
The food was good but not great when compared to Parada in Walnut Creek, which I believe has the same owner?  I tried the same entree here as I did at Parada, the Lomo Saltado, and it just didn't burst in flavor like Parada's.  My husband however, enjoyed his.  He ordered the Adobado and he said it tasted better.  
Overall, a nice experience.  We live in the East Bay so if given a choice, we'd stay local and go to Parada.
author: Minnie B.

description: Came here for brunch today and service was great. Staff was very friendly and food was delicious. We got the huevos a la pobre, brioche French toast and scramble. All were really good.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Great food, great atmosphere, awesome service.
Jorge was outstanding with the service and his recommendations. Thanks!
author: Javier C.

description: Good food but the servers and bartender can't handle it being busy. We went on a Friday night and waited 20minutes for two shots of tequila. I wouldn't come back because of the service.
author: Gabriela M.

description:
Ordered the fried pork chicharone sandwich and the Lomo saltado sandwich .
Delicious.  Hostess not so warm but the food was fast and delicious
author: Jessica G.

description:
I would have given 5 stars if it were a little cheaper....Dinner for two was about $75 with tax and tip ( and only one beer split between us.) We probably could have eaten for $60 if I'd ordered more carefully, but everything looked so good so maybe (definitely) I went a little overboard.

We started with the stuffed calamari and taquenos. We loved the calamari...it looked a little dorky ( like a carrot sculpture) but oh yum. It was stuffed with chorizo and had a walnut sauce, and simple salad ( arugula maybe?) with red onion in a really citrus-y vinaigrette. 
I would definitely get that again. The taquenos were stuffed with cheese and came with tamarind sauce and guacamole. I liked this, but it didnt wow me like the calamari did. 

Next we split a seafood stew which came with coconut rice. We ordered grilled asparagus on the side. The seafood stew had salmon, mussels, calamari and shrimp. We both liked the stew a lot. I'd put the name here....but dont see it listed on the menu online so sorry ( see photo.) I also thought the asparagus was really nice;  it was crisp/tender and came with a saffron sauce.

For dessert we had the churros. I'm a huge fan of churros and can even eat the fake-vanilla tasting ones at Costco. These were so not that...and so good. The were filled with dulche de leche and served with hot chocolate. Delicious!

The decor was sort of West Elm inside, the bathroom was clean, and service was professional. Everything was timed perfectly. A lot of other diners were having cocktails which looked beautiful, but we were not really in a drinking mood...

Yes, I'll go back, and will probably have the calamari relleno for my main course with churros for dessert.

If you're not familiar with this neighborhood, parking isn't an issue (spots on the street are pretty easy to find) and the views of downtown are stellar. 

:)
author: El B.

description:
This place is amazing the chef got my 5 starts!!
Flavor uh the best!!
Try it the paella or arroz con mariscos!
Really good 
I love it!!!
author: Angela C.

description:
A bit cheaper than La Mar, but it wasn't as good. Ceviche was good, but they charge extra ($4-$7) for chips. Who eats ceviche without chips? Seafood paella was super bland, had to send back just for some salt! Crazy. Octopus was good though, gave a lot more meat than I expected. Tuna tartare was super small, for $17.

Environment was nice, and waiters are attentive. Location is a bit out of the way as well. We probably will just go to La Mar next time... 

Sad that there isn't a cheap and good peruvian place in SF :(
author: Mingmei N.

description: I was invited to join my cousins to celebrate our aunt's birthday.  We had reservations at 7 and we were seated in time.  The cocktails are unique and special.  We started with their starters must have had 7 different items.  Fresh tasty and some had a kick in the flavors.  We all ordered dinner.  There was half organic roasted chicken, pulled pork, spareribs, fried rice, ahi, pork belly skewers, me he de Tigre, Kimi saltsdo, crispy cebiche, cebiche chino,paella, ceviche,pulpito a la Padilla.  Service was excellent, we were not rushed and had a very enjoyable dinner and did not leave until 10!!! Make sure you make a reservation for your experience!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
So normally this place is on point but tonight I had an incident l. So I was having dinner with a girlfriend and the dinner started out great, with a great Russian server she was awesome, until she accidentally spilled two glass of white wine on my lava a cake dessert, my IPhone 6, and my designer Tory Burch purse. Mind you accidents happen but the way management delt with the situation was ALL WRONG!!! So they offered to re-make my desert, but before that I ordered a glass of Malbec after drinking a whole bottle of Cabernet and the manager decided to point out that the Malbec was more expensive then the Cabernet we were drinking ( FYI DID I ASK WHAT THE PRICE WAS ....HOW RUDE!!!) Then the male manager comes back to serve the Malbec and says "I know what happened so I will comp you this glass of expensive Malbec  REALY!!! After all was said and done we still had to pay our bill which in my eyes should of been comp considering the value of my phone and purse was four times the amount of my bill. What happened to customer service I know accidents happen, I've been a server but when you make a mistake you fix and you make sure your customer wants to come back.... that won't be happening ...

So just an update of my review which I think is even more insulting  the restaurant send me a message stating their sorry and are offering me a $25.00 gift card to come back REALLY!!!! 

Thank you, but no thank you. While money is not the issue, my tab was $200, and you're only offering me $25. 
I shouldn't have had to give you a bad review for you to offer $25
This should have been taken care of that same day, which by the way was Thursday. Again, thank you but no thank you. Your $25 just added insult to injury, and now I definitely won't be returning. 
PS- thankfully my $600 phone is working just fine.
author: Leslie C.

description: Loved it!  Will be going out of my way to return.  To start, very special, delicious Pisco sours, garnished with a cinnamon cocoa sugar,  that seemed instantly to transport the drinker to South America, and warm, salty purple potato chips.  We split sticky ribs (yummy), yucca fries and a mushroom empanada, all excellent.  Restaurant goes out if its way to give a little extra to everything: a crisp jicama cabbage slaw on the ribs, a spicy drizzle for the empanada , and two dips for the fries (loved the yellow one).  Really nice service and a good vibe. We'd just returned from LA and remarked Mochica was as cool as anything there. Definitely bringing people here, including from out of town.
author: Lisa S.

description: I liked the ambiance and nice and welcoming crew. The food was not that great. Lama soltado meat was a little dry and not rice was not tasty. The ny steak was not cooked as requested and ceviche seemed to have some sort of acidic ingredient beside lime.
author: Omid A.

description:
I had the pleasure of dining here last week for the first time while on vacation. After a 9 hour drive from San Diego, dinner here was more than I could have asked for. We ordered family style and tried many of the hot and cold appetizers as well as a couple of main dishes. The highlights for me were the macaroni and cheese, which is served piping hot in a creamy cheese sauce with bacon and shrimp. Another favorite was the chicken skewer and the grilled shrimp which is served with a divine sauce and crusty bread. Each of the dishes were clearly and thougtfully crafted and even though we were the last ones to arrive in the restaurant that night, the service and quality were still top notch.  

To wash it all down, I had a homemade sangria which was flavored just right and not too sweet, though I do wish it had more fruit in it. We also had the churros and panna cotta for dessert. I would say the panna cotta was my least favorite dish of the night, but I am not a huge fan of custard that has the texture of jelly. The freshly made churros, on the other hand, were fantastic. Mochica offers a great variety of dishes with wonderful flavor and great service. I will defintely be coming back here the next time I am in town!
author: Ekta P.

description: Just had some cocktails and got to try the sweet potato chips as a snack, but this place left a great impression. Tony was a great bartender! Wish I could have eaten dinner here, as the menu looked fantastic, but I was already scheduled to meet a friend for dinner across the street.
author: Beck E.

description:
Stopped in here for lunch as Plow and Chez Maman had ridiculously long wait times for a table. We ordered a couple of libations before our food came. We ordered the cebiche de pescado with an extra bowl of plantain chips, oysters, lomo saltado and the roasted beet salad with hominy, goat cheese and oranges. The food was good, however the oysters were not fresh. Our server took it off our bill. 

The guys liked their cocktails and especially that purple corn drink. I'd come back for the cebiche and the gringa cocktail.
author: Mika D.

description: Recently sat at the bar for dinner here and liked the colorful interior. I really liked my pisco sour and the bolitas de yucca, which reminded me of arancini. For our main course we got the lomo saltado with a fried egg. It was pretty good, but not something I would order again.
author: Teryll H.

description:
This is more a 4.5 stars. Visited for Happy Hour. Very tasty food, drinks and good service. Although we started at happy hour, we moved to a table in the dining room. The food was incredible. The roasted Chicken with two sauces , fries and salad is a must have! 
For Happy Hour the fries with fried chicken were so good . The sangria is tasty, fresh and with strong wine content.
The service in the dining room was a bit pushy in up selling though.... too pushy but nice and professional.
We will definitely be back. The Bartender is very nice.
author: Junior V.

description:
Very different taste and delicious meal!
Loved the Sangria, the quinoa risotto, the corazon skewers and cheese dough appetizer!
Nice space, good vibe and nice crowd make this an excellent place for a couple or a small group of friends! 
Many dishes to try and a nice selection of dessert wines to accompany your dessert (try the lukuma).
Highly recommended!
author: George K.

description:
Wow! Mochica totally flies under my radar, hidden in Potrero Hill, but it's definitely worth it to come check it out.

We ordered the ceviche, chicken chicharrones, bolitas de yucca, scallops. I was not a huge fan of the ceviche; felt like it was missing some acidity brightness. The fish itself was also not super fresh. However, all of the other dishes were spot on - their chicharrones were meatier/less crispy than other places', but so flavorful. The bolitas were perfect fluff balls that come with a crack sauce. Took me a while to remember that our 4th dish was scallops, so I guess you could say they weren't super memorable, but at least were good quality.

Make sure to check in on Yelp, as it comes with a complimentary shot of pisco, which you do want to try and taste on its own. The pisco sour that they do here has nice foamy egg whites, with a dusting of cinnamon - very, very good. I also ordered another pisco cocktail, called something like sexy smart s___other alliterative adjective. Nothing was too sweet or too sour, which is great because they have a huge cocktail menu that begs trying.

I think it was a bit pricy overall (the bill rang in at a little over $100 for 3 people, not including tip), but honestly I love a good tapas place, and it's a great spot to bring your friends!
author: Stella A.

description:
Sangria and forbidden pisco strong and good to kickstart.

Chicharon mushroom,tequenos and quinoa risotto with sauces wonderful.

Panna cotta amazing.
author: Priyanka L.

description: Definitely 5 star restaurant. The food is very delicious and well made. My favorite Peruvian plates are both Ceviche de Pescado and Lomo Saltado. However, their Chanco Adobado(pork shoulder) was on another level. I highly recommend ordering that dish if you are a pork lover, otherwise go with more traditional dishes such as Aji de Gallina (chicken in yellow pepper sauce) or Lomo Saltado (stir fried Fillet Beef with veggies and fries). And don't forget to order a Pisco Sour!
author: Hagop H.

description:
I'm very surprised that this place only has a 3 1/2 rating on Yelp.  My first experience here was definitely a 5 star experience - both for the food and wonderful service. 

My husband and I came here on my birthday for lunch this past Sunday.  We were walking through Potrero on our walk back from the Dogpatch to the Mission after brunch on Saturday, and stumbled upon this cute little gem.  We had seen it before, but had never actually stopped to look at the menu.  We are huge fans of ceviche and Peruvian cuisine, so we decided to pop in on Sunday for lunch.

SERVICE: As soon as we walked in the door, we were greeted with the utmost hospitality.  The host gave a very warm welcome, and our server was so friendly and warm.  Both wished me a happy birthday (which my husband had mentioned in our Open Table reservation); and as soon as we'd had some time to look at the menu, the waitress offered me any drink of choice on the house in honor of my birthday.  How sweet of them, right?  

DRINKS:  I opted for a spicy mezcal drink (forget the exact name of it, but it was definitely 5 stars) - normally I am a little uncertain about ordering "specialty cocktails" out at a restaurant because they are often too syrupy and sweet for my taste.  This was not the case - it had quite a bit of spice (which I was looking for), and the drink was perfectly balanced - only the freshest of ingredients went into the drink (fresh squeezed juice, etc.); none of that artificial pre-made syrupy stuff.  It was one of the best mixed drink I've had out at a restaurant.  

My husband selected to try the sangria (per my husband, 4.5 stars), which he was a huge fan of.  In fact, he said it was his favorite sangria that he's had since our trip last year to Spain (where he pretty much lived on sangria ;)).

Part way through the meal, the waitress stopped back to check in on us - at which time my husband ordered another glass of sangria.  The waitress asked me if I liked wine (which I assured her I did), and she offered me a glass of sparkling wine on the house (by way of the manager).  This TOTALLY took me by surprise, and was so very appreciated!  Of course, I accepted the offer - and the sparkling was quite delicious :)

FOOD: We were really in the mood for ceviche, so we decided to try two different kinds, along with another small plate to share.

Cebiche Mixto (4.5 stars): Fresh fish, mussels & clams, shrimp in lime juice-aji rocoto leche de tigre.  This dish was so fresh, citrusy, and light - the seafood was perfectly cooked, had no "fishiness" to it whatsoever, and everything had such great texture.  Even the calamari was tender, which many times can be chewy when not prepared properly.  I think if we had to select only one of the ceviches to order, we'd opt for this one.  But even that's hard to say, as we love both of them pretty much equally.  The only reason I'd say we'd probably go with this one is because it was the lightest tasting of the two, prepared in a style we typically feel like (citrusy, bright, fresh), and had a mixture of different kinds of seafood, which was fun.

Cebiche Chino (4.5 stars): Ahi tuna, ginger, scallions, rocoto-hoisin leche de tigre & toasted nori.  Obviously from the title and list of ingredients, this one had more of an "Asian" twist to it, with the sesame oil and ginger.  The ahi was so tender and fresh; and the addition of the fried corn-nut like additions played so well with the texture of the fish.  

Grilled chicken skewer with crispy potato, salsa casera & anticucho sauce (4.5 stars):  Honestly, we could have been done and comfortably full since the portion size of each ceviches was so generous.   My husband actually said "if they forget about the chicken skewer, I would almost be relieved."  But then they brought the chicken skewer - and after one bite, my husband retracted his initial statement by saying "I take that back, this is so stupid good I am ordering this every time even if I'm too full!"  

SERVICE:  As I alluded to in the beginning, we experienced some of the best service we have ever had (even considering the $$$/$$$$ restaurants we have been to).  They had the perfect amount of attentiveness so it didn't feel like they were hovering, but any time your glass was close to empty or looked like you may need something, someone was there to attend to our needs.  And each encounter (from the manager, to waitress, to bus boys) was exceptional.  Good job Mochica, stellar experience!!!

I highly recommend stopping in to Mochica.  I know we will definitely be back again, and will also be recommending to others.  A great lunch or dinner spot any day of the week.
author: Rachael S.

description: Convenient neighborhood restaurant in Potrero Hill - definitely one our go-tos, since the prices are generally reasonable, and you almost never have to wait for a seat.  The food is also really good, especially the aji de gallina, pork belly chaufa, and alfajores.  The beef empanada, however, is the best dish here - probably the best empanada I've ever had, with flavorful beef, the right dash of sweetness, and a flaky crust.  Pretty steep at $13 for a single empanada, but delicious.  Overall, a place you'll want to come back to over and over again.
author: Simon L.

description: This place is amazing. Food is so delicious and the service is really great. The staff know us, they are kind, they check in often, and do everything in their power to make sure we had a pleasant experience. We end up here once a week at least.
author: Anca D.

description:
A friend of mine and I came here a few weeks back. Let me just say we cleaned our plates. Im sure the strong drinks played a role in our ferocious appetites but I regret nothing and almost wish we ordered more. 

Highly recommend 
-Cebiche Chino
-Pulpito a la Parilla 
-Pork belly beef skewers
-Peruvian Corn & Beet Salad

All cocktails are generously poured and delicious. Try the one with the sweet potato. Amazing. Absolutely amazing. I also ordered two others that were just as fantastic but cant remember the names :)

And lets not forget about the adorable location. This place is an all around knock out. Great for date, friends gathering, family style-you get the point. Visit the charming neighborhood and try Mochica.
author: Denniz S.

description:
Favorite spot in Potrero Hill... Possibly in all of SF!

The Pallata Rellena is a MUST... if avocado is your thing. It is an avocado stuffed with chicken and Peruvian potatoes, amongst other yummy goodies. Not to mention, it comes out looking beautiful. The colors on the dish are simply brilliant. 

Also, the Tequenos. Get. The Tequenos. A cheese stuffed pastry with avocado and sweet/spicy dipping sauces makes this dish an amazing sweet and savory dish. 

Also, the service is lovely. They make you feel very welcome!

PS you can make a reservation online. Nifty!!
author: Rachael M.

description:
The ensalada chola is really good
Ceviche chino was excellent and a must try
The side of plantain chips were terrible
The lomo Saltado was ok
The ribs were ok
Good service
1 tv with sports at the bar
author: Jones T.

description:
Review based on four visits.

*First visit: Decent pisco sours let down by mediocre food, pricey, not a good value. But I live a few blocks away and the other places on the block have long lines...

*Second visit: (Fool me once...) Excellent ceviche, spare ribs, and salad. Maybe the first time was a fluke?

*Third visit: Sat at the bar. Service was very off (despite the place being empty). Felt like the B Team was in the kitchen. Ordered the same salad, greens were wilted, with some rotted black edges. Yeeeech.

Same ceviche order also not nearly as good. Noooope. Maybe their ingredient deliveries are only once a week? Another dish was mixed up (if you have two ribs on the menu, on different pages, best to clarify with the customer which "ribs" they'd like, dontchathink?). Entree ribs they did bring were pretty flavorless. Drinks still good, which anesthetized things a bit.

*Fourth visit: (Fool me four times...)  Service downright lackadaisical. Ordered ceviche, was asked "would you like plantain chips along with that?". When the bill came, saw that was a $4 upcharge. We felt very misled, the phrasing implied that they came with the dish (as it does with many ceviches, much less $17.50 ones.) 

Salad greens were like the two-week-old-ones-you-eat-at-home-when-everything-is-closed, the ones where you pull out the extra-wilted ones while washing. 

Table's sweet potato chips were downright soggy. 

Drink was still good, but lesson finally learned. 

I miss Rocket Fish at this location.
author: Anton E.

description:
Meh...
Pros: the place has nice interior 
Cons: the service is slow and not on point, food is OK.  The price is on the higher side of what you get.

I took my co-workers here for lunch.  We arrived early to make sure we beat the rush.  The servers seemed confused and scattered.  I ordered Machica scramble and asked for ketchup.  Ketchup never came.  I had to ask for the bill two times.  The fruit that came with my meal was in a bowl that was put in the center of the table and everyone was confused whether this was a communal fruit bowl.
author: Mike B.

description:
Wandered in here on a whim, and couldn't have been more surprised by what a wonderful place this was. The decor was rustic and welcoming, and the open kitchen was alive and busy.

I ordered the Crispy Cebiche from the happy hour menu, which was extremely lightly battered and delicious. I also got the BBQ pork spareribs, which was fantastic as well. 

The drinks were awesome as well! The pisco sour is to die for, and even better were two manager's specials (I don't think they're even named yet). 

I would definitely go back the next time I am looking for unusual food and drinks.
author: Joyce L.

description: This place is phenomenal and the chef earned every A he received. I had dinner at Mochica a couple of years ago. It was not bad but I wasn't impressed. A friend suggested we have dinner there, so I gave it another chance. This time my mind was blown. Every dish we ordered was so good. The baby octopus was so flavorful and grilled to perfection. Tuna tartar with the plantain chips was pretty good. But the show stopper was the grilled squid stuffed with chorizo. OMG I went back the next day to get it again. Soooo amazing.
author: Shana W.

description: Pales  in comparison to limon or la mar. The cebiche china was awful, sweet chili sauce ruined it. Other cebiches were good, but nothing special. Also got a salchipollo (fried chicken from happy hr menu) but there was so little chicken, i felt we just paid for french fries w some fried chicken bits that got stuck in the fryer! $96 later, i came home and made a salad due to dissatisfaction and little food
author: Tommy C.

description:
Had the most amazing late night dinner here after work tonight. Found a spot at the bar right away and their bartender Norris took excellent care of me. He was very friendly, knowledgable, attentive and made me feel very welcome.

For dinner tonight I ordered the ceviche chino peruano, pork belly skewers and a side of sautéed spinach with garlic, yummy!

I will definitely be back and highly recommend it to others, thank you Mochica! :)
author: Larissa C.

description:
I'm really surprised this place doesn't have at least 4 stars (edit: now it does! Woohoo!). I haven't had Peruvian food this good outside of Lima. My only complaint is that I wish they'd serve a giant basket of the fresh purple potato chips and spicy/tart salsa fresca, instead of the cute little plate-sized portion. N'aw dude, I'm gunna need a whooole lot more than that. I would pay for the option!

Try the ceviche if you like fish, and the empanadas if you like things that are delicious (my husband prefers the chorizo version, and I love the vegetarian one with mushrooms). Their plantain chips are awesome with any of the shareables. We've always had fantastic service -- the staff is funny and very nice -- but everything is made fresh so it is definitely not a quick grab-and-go spot. Expect to hang out for a bit!
author: Melinda C.

description:
Absolutely outstanding food and service, and what felt like a very authentic Peruvian experience. I'm so glad we live nearby, Potrero-hill has some real gems, and this place is certainly one of them. 

We tried several outstanding tapas dishes, followed by a couple of specials including a wonderful whole fish with polenta and salad. Service was fast, courteous and just very good period. Highly recommend this place!
author: Noam S.

description: Not much to say disappointed.  Ceviche and lomo is awfully cooked.  Not traditional at all.
author: Victor E.

description: Never again.  A one-time favorite has disappointed for the last time.  Their beef empanadas (at about $15 for one) was once the best appetizer - amazing crust, lots of carrots and potatoes and some kind of elegant sauce... last time, this week, we got one as an app and it was SO AWFUL, the $3 Jamaican patties I get are 100 times better - the pastry was greasy as was the all the meat inside - and there was NO veggies, just greasy beef.. plus a cheap salsa on the side.  Was once a favorite but again - NEVER again.
author: F U L L M O O N.

description:
I came here on a Wednesday night for date night and i was very very surprised. I remember going to this restaurant when it was in SoMa. But this new location in Potrero Hill is a lot more trendy and fun. 

The hostess was meh and didnt even tell us how long the wait was she said the only options were the community table and the bar. 

So we sat at the bar (which in the end im really hapoy we did) and were greeted by the bartender Tony. He promptly gave us a food menu, a cocktail menu and blue potato chips with a really good lemon onion dipping juice. 

It was really hard choosing a cocktail since there were so many and they all seemed delicious. I went with bitter sweet love which is a light pink with lemon peel garnish served in a martini glass. It was sweet and definitely on the bitter side so the name suits it. My boyfriend had the Summer diet which was also served in a martini glass with a light green color and cucumber garnish. It really was refreshing. 

To start we had a chorizo empanada, ceviche peruano chino, and anticuches of beef heart. Everything was so good. The anticuchos were definitely my favorite very meaty and cooked perfectly to a medium with anticuchera sauce and I believe chimichurri with a potato that had some kind of creamy sauce.

Dinner took us awhile since we met some cool people at the bar and Tony also engaged with us. It was really fun. 

For the main course we had pork belly chaufa and the salmon bandido. The chaufa was rich in flavor and filling. The salmon was tender and cooked to the point of juciness. It has blue potato mash underneath with some tomato like stew. I decided to accompany this meal with some Mochica sangria which btw was excellent. 
 
Finally for dinner we had a sampler of the churros filled with Dulce de leche with a side of hot chocolate, vanilla panna cotta, and quinoa flan. My favorite was the panna cotta. It was fresh with vanilla beans on top. 

Through out our dinner not only was Tony checking on us but also a server named Rana. She was very friendly and even had casual conversation which is always appreciated. I will definitely be coming back here some time!!
author: Viviana M.

description: Stopped for dinner before the theatre. Wonderful little restaurant in the Protrero Hill area. Love the decor and the vibe. Service was friendly and efficient. We started with the ceviche which was delicious! Also tried the mushroom empanada which was ok, perhaps a bit underbaked. Main courses we tried included the pork belly rice dish and egg, a fusion of paella and fried rice-delicious and generous portion. Also tried the roasted chicken which was moist and flavorful. Too full for dessert-maybe next time! Definitely recommend Mochica.
author: Debbie L.

description:
I visited the restaurant last night our reservation was at 7 and even that we show up one hour earlier all was ready.
We decided to have some drinks at the bar, Yuri the bartender was knowledgeable and always smiling.
Once we sit down we order different types of dishes, all very colorful and tasty.
Marco our server was very attentive and he made great food recomendations, the staff in general was very friendly as well 
I will be back to taste more delicious food.
author: Marcel B.

description:
This is a great little spot in Potrero.

Sitting or dining at the bar is highly recommended. The bartenders are great and the service very prompt.

The menu here has a lot of Peruvian classics and often has more than one dish that will surprise you. Go for it!
author: Stephen W.

description: Had lunch here recently, and it was delicious. I can't wait to return. The empanada had a light flaky crust that was unexpected and welcome and made it so tasty. We had a good rendition of Lomo Saltado, but the real star was the Chancho de adobado. Wow. Fork tender pork and an incredible sauce. mmm.
author: Mark M.

description:
Wandered down to Potrero hill on a nice sunny day in SF. A lot of the restaurants on -18th had a long wait, but Mochica did not. Oh, and it was amazing! Everything was great. Ordered 6 dishes and shared family style. Definitely get the pollo a la brasa and share. 

Make sure to check in for the free pisco shot. It wasn't necessary, but sure was fun!

I would come back for sure!
author: Edward M.

description:
Ugh! Come on Yelp--yet another over rated restaurant. Maybe it's what we ordered but I was certainly not impressed. Ceviche was yummy, however; when asked if we want plantain chips we said yes only to see on the bill that we were charged extra! If not plantain chips, then what do you eat ceviche with? 

Tuna tartar was aight but drenched in a very powerful sauce that masked the delicacy of the fish. 

Pulpito--burnt baby octopus with no seasoning. We actually sent this one back, couldn't eat it. 

Yucca fries are yummy but that cheese sauce, not my cup of tea. 

Giving it 2.5 stars over 2 b/c the staff was great and I really want to like this place. But working within Yelp stats it's a 2...
author: Howard G.

description: Delicious! Pulled ahi chicken omlete for brunch was wow. Great spicy Bloody Mary as well
author: Natalia G.

description:
This place was a little out of the box for me.  I have to report I was pleasantly surprised.  The food was very fresh and the service was exceptional.

Here it comes:

Al says you gotta eat here!
author: Alexander D.

description: Delicioso!! Maravilloso!! I came here with my  Peruvian friend and we ordered the Bolitas de Yucca (5 stars yummy), Causas Pulpito Bebe (5*), Lomo Saltado with Egg (5*) and Seco des Res (4*)...enjoyable, extremely loud and trendy dinner spot on a Saturday night!  Chilean red wine was unfiltered and a bit cloudy, but good. Be prepared for crazy $16 pre-dinner cocktails!! I understand how folks can be annoyed by the pricey drinks!
author: William H.

description: I just don't think I'm a fan of Peruvian food, so this might not be the most accurate review for this restaurant. I tried their roast chicken and the seafood paella. Their chicken skin was crispy,  and the sauces were good, but I don't think I liked the seasoning/rub on the chicken itself. The paella is not the traditional Spanish style that I like and is used to. Overall everything was fine.
author: H. L.

description: I've eaten here three  times, I've never had a bad meal. However I hadn't noticed their food score rating (cleanliness/food safety) until last time. 76/100? That is terrifying. I am hesitant to eat here again.
author: Jessi N.

description: Great place.  Food is awesome.  Service is great.  This place is clean atmosphere feel warm and inviting. You need to try this place
author: Ray R.

description: I was surprised by cozy atmosphere, delicious food of Mochica and great service by Jorge! My friends suggested me to try it for some time but i only had the chance last night! Definitely coming back!
author: Marichka K.

description: The best restaurant in this area! Food are so good. I love Tiradino tuna, Anticucho Corazon and churros!!!! Bartender Kina and server Vika, are very, very friendly and caring! Would strongly recommend this place. Happy hours are every day 4:30 to 6:30.
author: Yelena T.

description: Great Peruvian food, our server, Jorge, recommended lomo saltado and paella , best choice ever! Loved the food and service :)
author: Maria Beatriz R.

description: Great Restaurant. A friend of mine told me about this place so I decided to stop by with with my girlfriend a couple of days ago. We ordered the Lomo Saltado and a couple of ceviches and the food was sooo good!! There was a lot of people when we arrived but our sever Jorge went above and beyond checking on us all the time and making sure we were all set!! Great service, great food, great experience!
author: Michael A.

description:
Don't really know what to say.  This was by far the worst service I've ever experienced.  My wife and I came in about 820pm on New Years Eve and ordered fairly quickly.  By 10pm we only received 1 of the 4 dishes we ordered.

Playing Sporcle on our phone made the time pass by.  But then we realized the table next to us, that sat down at about 930pm, was receiving their food.  So we just got up and left.

Now it's 15 minutes later, I'm hungry and writing an angry Yelp review.  And I'm also down a free Bolitas de Yucca postcard, though I can't really say I'd ever go back to use it.

This really deserves Zero stars.
author: Felix C.

description:
So delicious, I never wanted the meal to end! 
The waiter was very friendly and gave us really good recommendations! I will be coming back every time I visit San Francisco.
author: Anneke B.

description:
I came with an old work friend for lunch. Delicious!  We both had the lomo saltado twas cooked perfectly.
I also tried the meyer lemon cocktail from the list which was the perfect amount of tart and sweet.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Gabriela H.

description: Yesterday was my first time in Mochica. Except of amazing cocktails service was so friendly by our server Jorge. Definitely Im going to come back more often! Great experience and warm ambiance!
author: Nazlı Ece K.

description:
I came here with a friend because it was new, so we thought to give it a try.  It was so stuffy in that place :( I know the weather wasn't that cold, but it shouldnt be THAT warm in there either.
Service was horribly slow. We saw 2-3 tables leave because they werent being served. Other than the service the food according to my friend was OK. I personally never tried as much food as he did but I will take his work for it. The fried rice my friend ordered for me was pretty good, I love the choclo! Never had it before.
author: Jade L.

description:
3.5 stars. 

The food is pretty good. The decor inside is nice, but it does get rather noisy and difficult to hear any conversation happening at your table without leaning in and everyone speaking loudly.  


The meat we ordered was all very good and especially tender. Fried chicken, lomo saltado, and the pork (chefs special). Did not get a chance to try the ceviche yet. 

We live on the hill so it's a convenient spot for us, however price-wise I believe limon is cheaper although quality may be a bit less than here.
author: Melody T.

description: The best service ever, Jorge was amazing! And his recommendations was perfect... lomo saltado and pulpito!!!
author: Maria M.

description:
We had a nice dinner here. The service was good. 

The pisco sour was sweet and good sized. We shared a ceviche for appetizer, and it was delicious. For entree the lomo saltado was very good! 

Finally, the alfajores cookies were the perfect desert. I'll go back if I'm in the area.
author: Melu L.

description:
Carlos Altamirano's Mochica is exceptional. As Potrero Hill dwellers we were loyal Rocket Fish diners on a weekly basis. 

We were blown away by Mochica's menu of amazingly designed small plates ranging from Cebiche Chino with its fresh tuna tartar to the Camarones al Ajo to chicken meat balls and Empanadas Peruana. Every dish equal to if not better then the next. We loved everything we ordered. The plate presentation was equally beautiful to feast with our eyes and our mouth. We are very excited to have such an spectacular restaurant in our neighbor we can enjoy for years to come.  

.
author: Michael R.

description: This place is so cute! I came here with my Peruvian friend because she really wanted me to try Peruvian cuisine. Lemme start off by saying: I was not disappointed. We got ceviche for appetizers. I'm not a huge fan of ceviche..but Peruvian ceviche is a totally different story. I think I id be able to scarf down six of those ceviche appetizers (not joking). Anyways for my entree I ordered the lomo saltado which came with very tender pieces of cubed steak, a side of rice, french fries and an egg on top. It was delicious! I was very pleased by the egg on top because I just love eggs and it made the dish royalty. But the meat is what really won me over. It was so juicy, tender, flavorful, and just mmmm. A bit pricy...like 19 bucks for that plate. But I really paid for the experience as well. The waiter was so extremely nice, and polite. He made sure my friend and I had the best service possible. He would socialize, bring us whatever we needed, he treated us like family, he was a very hospitable man, might I add. This place brings good memories. They had an Interesting menu that makes me want to visit a couple more times.
author: Malina B.

description: The food was absolutely delicious, but unfortunately even the food couldn't over shadow some of the other shortcomings.  My wife and I ordered the chicken to share, which comes with French fries.  We asked for sweet potato fries instead.  Both fries are the same price on the menu, but we were up-charged $3.50 for the sweet potato fries.  Then, we asked for an additional sauce for the chicken, but when the bill came we were up-charged for the sauce as well.  The service was average and our server forgot some of our requests, which was disappointing.  For all who would consider eating here.....caveat emptor.
author: Brian S.

description: It was our first time in Mochica and we really liked it! Delicious food and very friendly service from our server Jorge! Definitely coming back and suggesting it to all of my friends! Such a warm place to spend this cold evening.
author: Ilker C K.

description: A weird start but a good ending. We almost didn't try Mochica because when we walked in the door, we were completely ignored for more than a few minutes.  The hostess looked at us, no hello or other acknowledgement, then walked over to a customer at the bar to converse while we stood there 3 feet away.  So, once she decided we had waited long enough, she seated us and we had a very satisfying lunch.  Great quality ingredients, delicious and creatively put together sandwiches.  I may go back (the salmon sandwich would be worth it) but not if I see this woman at the door.  Too many other options to put up with rudeness.
author: Anne B.

description:
I am devoted to Mi Lindo Peru but I wanted to give this place a shot. Great location but the food and service was very disappointing. We got the table next to the bathroom and when we went to ask the hostess if we could get the table in front she had a pissed off face and gave us some attitude which was so unnecessary given the restaurant was not packed yet. Sorry but staring at people coming and going to the bathroom is not appetizing to all of us!

We had the ceviche chino,short ribs, and tequenos for appetizers. The ceviche was lacking the usual acid and heat that ceviches should. All three dishes had the same sweet sauce. So disappointing! The tequenos were also so sweet with the powdered sugar and tamarind  sauce that tasted just like the hoisin sauce from the spare ribs. 

The Paella tasted more like a jambalaya and the one shrimp on the dish was overlooked.
No flavor such a buck of cream was added to the soupy rice

Service was ok but lacked life and personality 


I love Peruvian food and after trying Fresca and Limon I still think the best flavors and value for your wallet is Mi Lindo Peru. We have gone there for many years and they don't EVER disappoint.
author: Miriam B.

description: My new favorite place for tapas/family style eats. I notice the menu changes a bit which keeps things interesting. All dishes I've tried have been delicious and very flavorful. I recommend the grilled beef heart anticuchos , lamb riblettes, and calamari relleno. They also have a wonderful spicy macaroni and cheese with shrimp! Definitely save room for dessert. I love the dulce de leche filled churros with hot chocolate.
author: Elaine W.

description:
Been back a few times since they opened and there are some standouts on the menu. 

The Pescado a la Parilla is my favorite thing, a curry seafood stew with a piece of beautifully seared fresh fish. The different cebiche are all good if a bit pricey. The service has improved too.
author: DeathandFood H.

description:
This restaurant was OK, but I wouldn't be excited about returning. 
Service: The busser was very nice and friendly, but our hostess and server seemed like they were doing us a favor for working. Our server was not rude, but definitely not friendly. He brought our food and drinks, but that was about all he offered. Didn't even give us the special information.

Drinks: the cocktails were rather good and different then I've tasted before. 

Food: pretty good, but not amazing. I had the paella. the rice was perfectly cooked, but the muscles were dry. good flavor though. My hubby had the pork belly rice dish, which he liked. Desert was pretty good (got the chocolate lava cake).

We also sat by the window and although it was closed, it was very drafty and I was freezing the entire night. I had to leave my jacket on. Very clean bathrooms though.
author: Meredith A.

description:
We made reservation for 5 ppl and as soon as we got there the seats were ready. It was Friday and was pretty crowded. 
The waiter was very nice to us, we took a little bit of time to start ordering since we were very exciting to see ea other. 
Once we order, the waiter forgot to get X person order (1st fault), after we were done we the appetizers the waiter dropped the sauce in the X person lol (2nd fault).. Omg, it was funny bc the waiter took his table cloth and rubbed in his sweater (the wife got so mad). And the waiter didn't even apologize. 
Over all, food is very good and ambient is little laugh for groups. 
*churros was the best thing ever*
author: Kim K.

description:
I am currently in one of Dantes circles of hell. Ordering takes 20 mins but the food is said to come in 5 mind. Sadly that was 20 mins ago. No sign of water which was promised. Waitstaff have repeatedly stressed how small the portions arr so I fully expect to leave hungry and poor - regular beers are $8. Will update in unlikely event things improve.

Update as promised: Food turned out to be great. Standouts were pork belly skewers (big meaty chunks), beef tongue (super tender and caramelized) and tuna tartare w house made potato chips. Overall we ordered 11 dishes for 7 of us and left full if not stuffed. Worked out at $46 per head including mandatory tip. Upgrading to 3 stars - 4 for food, 2 for service.
author: Diarmuid R.

description: Good food, but there is nothing particularly noteworthy about it. My boyfriend got the steak, which came out too rare and even though they took it back and put it on the grill again, it didn't change much. The best thing we ate was the mixed seafood ceviche for sure. I would eat here again, but there are definitely better places to eat in the neighborhood.
author: Erica V.

description:
It only took one visit, but this just became a new favorite in the city - took the time to walk back and shake the owner's hand, give my regards to the chef and line cooks. 

Looking forward to trying more on the menu or just stopping by for a drink.
author: Ben A.

description:
1h35min for a lunch service, for a restaurant half full (or half empty, as you wish).
We went there because the restaurants around this area were too packed. That was a good reason to try another address :) 
Soooooo slowwwwww.... And poor service. 20 min after ordering, they came back to say that one of our dish was unavailable. At the time to pay, i said that we were in a hurry since 2 of us had a meeting at 2pm. They took 15 min for payment. With such a bad experience, i would have expected a "commercial gesture". But no. They even included tips. They lost 6 customers at once. No wonder why this place was half empty during the rush hour.
author: Morgane M.

description:
I wanted to give my mark of peru-val but this place was OK (based on the plates I tried). To ceviche their own though. - #noodosisters on IG

My Peruvian friend and I were both craving Peruvian food and decided to try Mochica. The reviews on yelp were positive and the food just looked delicious! Overall, I was disappointed because it didn't taste like authentic Peruvian food, which is what I was craving, but the Pork Belly Chaufa made up for it!

Plantain Chips (3.5/4 stars): I thought these were amazing but it's because I love banana chips in general and this one was perfectly crispy with some sugar on it. 

Ahi Tuna Ceviche (2.5 stars): The Ahi Tuna itself was good but the sauce was just sweet and sour chili sauce (the sauce you dip eggrolls in). I didn't like this dish because it was all sweet with no salty or sour to balance it. I was expecting that sweet but sour to the point where your mouth hurts (I exaggerate, but, really though..). I would come back to try the Ceviche Mixto or Ceviche Pescado to taste how they make it. I just have this expectation of the Ceviche Mixto at Balcones in Los Angeles. SO. GOOD.  

Lomo Saltado (3 stars): The fries looked like mcdonalds fries. Let that soak in. Can you feel my sadness? Every lomo saltado I've had, the fries has always resembled steak cut fries. I have never seen skinny fries on lomo saltado. I thought maybe I was just being picky but my friend had the same sad look in his eyes also. Anyways, the dish itself was alright/good but it was missing that kick of soy sauce and vinegar flavor that gives lomo saltado that burst of flavor. If you like a more meaty/beef flavor (I mean, who doesn't?) then you'll like this! 

Pork Belly Chaufa (4 stars): This was my favorite dish of the night. Very flavorful, and the cubed pieces of pork belly just melts in your mouth. The only thing about this dish is that I'm not sure how "Peruvian" it is (not that it has to be authentic since Peruvian food is a mash up of several different cultural foods to begin with). It reminded me of Korean Kim chi Fried Rice but without the pieces of kim chi. Besides that, this dish was delicious and I gave it 4 stars because I would order it again.

We made reservations and the service was great. The price ranged from $15 - $20, which is normal for SF. My search for Peruvian food in SF continues!
author: Shirley Q.

description: If you can navigate around the hipsters the have taken over Potrero Hill, this place serves very solid Peruvian cuisine. The drinks are good too, but could use a bit more kick.
author: Asina G.

description: Delicious! We came here for dinner on a Friday night as a group of four. We didn't have a reservation, so they took our phone number and let us wander the neighborhood until a table opened up. Our waiter was awesome, always cracking jokes. My cocktail was really good -- the GreenGa. We shared a few plates of ceviche (amazing!) and then got our own entrees. The tuna tartare was great. We also shared the churros and hot chocolate for dessert. Will definitely be back!
author: Alysha V.

description: This place has a great vibe and really amazing food. The cocktails are expertly mixed and the food was rich with flavors and generous portions. I had the lomo saltado which was just as good as any I had in Peru. My partner had the ají chicken, so good also. The sauce was amazing, I stole his leftovers. Already looking forward to going back!
author: Nora C. E.

description: Been here twice, love this place.  The manager and the bartender remember us from the first vs.  I love their service and the cocktail.  Foods are good, the portion is big, will definitely come back to try more items on the menu.  The beet salad and the pisco sour is my favor!
author: Cora L.

description: Second time here and we won't likely be back. The food was adequate - my pork shoulder was certainly better than Louie's short ribs - but nothing could have made up for the failed service. It didn't start out bad but as the evening progressed our waiter simply disappeared. To add to the service failure were loud kids at the tables on both sides of us.  That's obviously not Mochica's fault, but I don't like dining in that type of setting.
author: Scott L.

description:
I've been looking forward to this opening in our neighborhood. Finally a good restaurant in a prime location which has been haunted by the awfulness that was Rocketfish. Mochica's sister restaurant on Cortland is great and they've really fixed up this space so that 18th St finally has a restaurant with a bar and a big communal table.

On my first visit, however, I was disappointed. Service was slow and irregular, and some of the dishes were too oily and overly salty. One of the ceviches was downright bizarre. Some of the issues were clearly just start-up difficulties, but others require some decisions. The wine list is one of the worst I've ever seen in SF. Whoever came up with that is really totally clueless. Beer selection is OK though. Cocktails look legit but I didn't have any on this occasion.

I'll give a 3rd start for effort and I'm gonna come back to check on the progress. I'd like to become a regular but they need to up their game for that to happen.
author: Oscar C.

description:
Service: 0/10
Food Taste: 2/10
Food Price: 0/10

This is the worst restaurant I've eaten in SF so far. We were literally made to feel bad for putting the waitresses out from the conversations they would much rather be having over with the kitchen staff, and the food was like a punishment. 

Even the hostess looked like she was chewing on wasps!

The food was extremely overpriced - my dish was literally served with a scattering of frozen cheap chunky fries. I haven't eaten those since I was a child.

Overpriced alcohol too considering we had to fight for the attention of a waitress just for water refills. And half the tables were empty (I'm sympathetic to staff if the place is busy)

Zero tip and I would passionately recommend not visiting this place.
author: Liam G.

description: Chef Martin Ore has opened up his second Mochica restaurant in Toronto and I'm happy to say the food and service is EXCELLENT. I  had the classic ceviche and a pisco sour and they were both delicious and totally authentic. My date had the alpaca burger, which we learned came from chef Martin's very own alpaca farm! The meat was so fresh, so tasty. Its the only place in the country where you can get alpaca meat. Definitely recommend this gem of a spot. Thank you Mochica!
author: Dayle M.

description:
Waited for about 30 minutes to get a glass of water, 45 minutes for the bottle of wine, and I lost count of time for when we were finally served food.   

We ordered 4 dishes.  The scallops carlitos was awful, the camarones al ajo and paella were passable.  Fish was overcooked and the flavors were average at best.

Three fourth of the way through our dinner, I asked the waitress about the fourth dish we ordered - the tequenos.  In an unapologetic fashion she informs me that they are completely out.  Would have been good to tell us that proactively about an hour and a half ago.

Fine.  I get it.  The food is meh.  But the service - unacceptable.  This place isn't cheap and unfortunately nothing about the experience made it worth it.  Disappointing.
author: Nikki G.

description:
Fantastic Peruvian food, the staff is very friendly yet professional, and takes care of you at all times.

Ask the bartender to show you some Latin American cocktails he will impress you for sure.
author: Mauricio G.

description:
1st impression, not too many authentic Peruvian dishes they don't have cuy, at least they haven't had it in a long time. Maybe it's becasue I went during brunch. But they had many sandwitches, which my husband from Peru says, Sandwitches are not common.  

I had their sandwitch (chicharon) with fries. Good size portion and it was good but should have known that it was fatty for being chicharon.

I had their passion fruit beverage. It came in its own bottle. It was extremely sweet for me but was nice I had an extra glass to water it down.

Had their alfajores and it was pretty yummy. Soft and crunchy, just how I like it. I also tried their Panna Cotta. It taste like vanilla bean ice cream but the texture was like a hard boil egg. I shared it and it was good enough for me. It is somewhat rich. 

The price is high for what it is but I guess that is normal for being San Francisco. I do want to come back for their ceviche, though.
author: Michelle C.

description: The lomo saltado it's different as the traditional one ,maybe is ok for Americans.anticuchos are good next time I will ask sauces on the side .
author: Juan Carlos P.

description:
Well...in the previous location this was one of my favorite Peruvian restaurants. The food was fresh, exciting and mostly authentic in a warm, attractive setting. 

We went with another couple last night and were very disappointed. The location was fine and we managed to snag a parking spot just half a block away. The higher level room had Nasca lines painted on the wall - I'm not sure what was painted on the walls of the room we were in - but it didn't add to the atmosphere. 

Our waiter too enthusiastically approved of anything we ordered but he did answer questions and delivered food as it popped out of the kitchen.                                                       We had been to this restaurant a dozen times before and we always loved the complimentary little bowl of garbonzo beans with onion, cilantro and lime juice. It was an inventive few bites to let you know that more tasty food was on the way. That was replaced with what amounted to a thimble full of cancha (toasted large Peruvian corn) per person. When we inquired, the waiter said he'd let the chef know we missed the garbonzo concoction. 

The ceviche (halibut) was fine - served with both choclo and cancha. We also had the beet salad and the dressing (maracuya - passionfruit) somewhat clashed with the sweetness of the beets. This same dressing was a perfect pairing with the green salad though, which was delicious. 

Unfortunately, one of the most well-known Peruvian dishes, papas a la Huancaina was a flop. Note to chef - adding bacon to a dish - doesn't necessarily improve it. When I saw it on the menu I was actually shocked (and, yes, I AM Peruvian). This dish is the mac and cheese of Peruvian cuisine - nicely cooked (usually boiled) potatoes covered in a slightly spicy cheese sauce. The sauce is yellowish from the medium spicy and fruity pepper, aji amarillo which are usually only available dried or in jars here - though I did have an admiral crop in my garden this year. Their potatoes the waiter told us were grilled. There were several Fred Flintstone sized thick chunks of dry potatoes with peel on barely coated with a scant portion of their spicy version of the Huancaina sauce and the aforementioned bacon on top. Without a doubt this was the most expensive and worst rendition of this dish I've ever had. And I've had it several hundred times. Do not, do not mess with papas a la Huancaina.
